Event.name: Deception_scenario
Event.definition: <def-root>Deception is a scenario in which a <fen>Deceiver</fen> attempts to make it such that a <fen>Victim</fen> comes to an incorrect understanding about a <fen>Topic</fen>. This may be done by presenting a misleading <fen>Phenomenon</fen> to the <fen>Victim</fen>, or by concealing the existence of items which the <fen>Victim</fen> may be interested in. Note that the <fen>Victim</fen> is not necessarily aware of the (possible) existence of the <fen>Topic</fen>or items related to it.</def-root>

Arg.name: Victim
Arg.definition: <def-root>The Victim is the target of the deception.</def-root>

Arg.name: Deceiver
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Deceiver</fen> attempts to make the <fen>Victim</fen> unable to know about or detect the truth about a Phenomenon or Topic.</def-root>

Arg.name: Phenomenon
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is presented to the <fen>Victim</fen> as a way to mislead about the <fen>Topic</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Topic
Arg.definition: <def-root>The entity to which the misleading idea relates, what it is about.</def-root>
